document.masterDocTitle: Review of species of the Old World genus Doryctophasmus Enderlein, 1912 (Hymenoptera: Braconidae: Doryctinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of species of the Old World genus Doryctophasmus Enderlein, 1912 (Hymenoptera: Braconidae: Doryctinae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of the genus
Doryctophasmus

paragraph.keyLead: - Malar space 0.50–0.55 × height of eye ( Figs 2 , 56 ). Face width 1.15–1.20 × height of eye ( Figs 2 , 56 ). Hind coxa longer, 2.1– 2.2 × longer than maximum width ( Figs 14 , 70 ). Length of first metasomal tergite 4.2–4.4 × its maximum width ( Figs 16 , 67 ), 2.3–2.4 × length of propodeum. Median length of second tergite 2.9–3.2 × its basal width ( Figs 15, 16 , 68, 69 ).......... 3

4 ( 1 ). Second radial abscissa shorter than first abscissa. First tergite very finely rugose, with longitudinal wrinkles at apex. Recurrent vein interstitial. Body length 5.5 mm .— South Africa ..........................................
D. africanus Brues

- Second radial abscissa usually not shorter than first abscissa ( Figs 44 , 82 ). First tergite densely undulately striate with rugosity or distinctly rugulose-reticulate in basal 0.7 and longitudinally striate in apical 0.3 ( Figs 47 , 86 ). Recurrent vein more or less distinctly postfurcal ( Figs 43, 44 , 81, 82 ).................................................................. 5
